Name: BRADYKIN

Alternatively, some reduced amplitude', '3': 'Moderate slowness, poverty or small amplitude of movement', '4': 'Marked slowness, poverty or small amplitude of movement', '8': 'Untestable'}

Name: WRTHLESS
Description: Do you feel pretty worthless the way you are now?

Name: ENERGY
Description: Do you feel full of energy?

Name: HOPELESS
Description: Do you feel that your situation is hopeless?

Name: BETTER
Description: Do you think that most people are better off than you are?

Name: NACCGDS
Description: Total GDS Score

Name: BILLS
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Writing checks, paying bills, or balancing a checkbook
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: TAXES
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Assembling tax records, business affairs, or other paper
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: SHOPPING
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Shopping alone for clothes, household necessities, or groceries
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: GAMES
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Playing a game of skill such as bridge or chess, working on a hobby
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: STOVE
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Heating water, making a cup of coffee, turning off the stove
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: MEALPREP
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Preparing a balanced meal
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: EVENTS
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Keeping track of current events
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: PAYATTN
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Paying attention to and understanding a TV program, book, or magazine
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: REMDATES
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Remembering appointments, family occasions, idays, medications
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: TRAVEL
Description: In the past four weeks, did the subject have any difficulty or need help with: Traveling out of the neighborhood, driving, or arranging to take public transportation
Values: {'0': 'Normal', '1': 'Has difficulty, but does by self', '2': 'Requires assistance', '3': 'Dependent', '8': 'Not applicable (e.g., never did)', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: NACCNREX
Description: Were all findings unremarkable?
Values: {'0': 'Abnormal findings', '1': 'No abnormal findings or findings normal for age', '9': 'Unknown'}

Name: NORMEXAM
Description: Were there abnormal neurological exam findings?
Values: {'0': 'No abnormal findings', '1': 'Yes - abnormal findings were consistent with syndromes listed in Questions 2-8', '2': 'Yes - abnormal findings were consistent with age-associated changes or irrelevant to dementing disorders (e.g., Bell’s palsy)'}

Name: FOCLDEF
Description: Are focal deficits present indicative of central nervous system disorder?

Name: GAITDIS
Description: Is gait disorder present indicative of central nervous system disorder?

Name: EYEMOVE
Description: Are there eye movement abnormalities present indicative of central nervous system disorder?

Name: PARKSIGN
Description: Parkinsonian signs

Name: RESTTRL
Description: Resting tremor - left arm

Name: RESTTRR
Description: Resting tremor - right arm

Name: SLOWINGL
Description: Slowing of fine motor movements - left side

Name: SLOWINGR
Description: Slowing of fine motor movements - right side

Name: RIGIDL
Description: Rigidity - left arm

Name: RIGIDR
Description: Rigidity - right arm

Name: BRADY
Description: bradykinesia

Name: PARKGAIT
Description: Parkinsonian gait disorder

Name: POSTINST
Description: Postural instability

Name: CVDSIGNS
Description: Neurological sign considered by examiner to be most likely consistent with cerebrovascular disease

Name: CORTDEF
Description: Cortical cognitive deficit (e.g., aphasia, apraxia, neglect)

Name: SIVDFIND
Description: Focal or other neurological findings consistent with SIVD (subcortical ischemic vascular dementia)

Name: CVDMOTL
Description: Motor (may include weakness of combination of face, arm, and leg; reflex changes, etc.) - left side

Name: CVDMOTR
Description: Motor (may include weakness of combination of face, arm, and leg; reflex changes, etc.) - right side

Name: CORTVISL
Description: Cortical visual field loss - left side

Name: CORTVISR
Description: Cortical visual field loss - right side

Name: SOMATL
Description: Somatosensory loss - left side

Name: SOMATR
Description: Somatosensory loss - right side

Name: POSTCORT
Description: Higher cortical visual problem suggesting posterior cortical atrophy (e.g., prosopagnosia, simultagnosia, balint's syndrome) or apraxia of gaze

Name: PSPCBS
Description: Findings suggestive of progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP), corticobasal syndrome (CBS), or other related disorders

Name: EYEPSP
Description: Eye movement changes consistent with PSP

Name: DYSPSP
Description: Dysarthria consistent with PSP

Name: AXIALPSP
Description: Axial rigidity consistent with PSP

Name: GAITPSP
Description: Gait disorder consistent with PSP

Name: APRAXSP
Description: Apraxia of speech

Name: APRAXL
Description: Apraxia consistent with CBS - left side

Name: APRAXR
Description: Apraxia consistent with CBS - right side

Name: CORTSENL
Description: Cortical sensory deficits consistent with CBS - left side

Name: CORTSENR
Description: Cortical sensory deficits consistent with CBS - right side

Name: ATAXL
Description: Ataxia consistent with CBS - left side

Name: ATAXR
Description: Ataxia consistent with CBS - right side

Name: ALIENLML
Description: Alien limb consistent with CBS - left side

Name: ALIENLMR
Description: Alien limb consistent with CBS - right side

Name: DYSTONL
Description: Dystonia consistent with CBS, PSP, or related disorder - left side

Name: DYSTONR
Description: Dystonia consistent with CBS, PSP, or related disorder - right side

Name: MYOCLLT
Description: Myoclonus consistent with CBS - left side

Name: MYOCLRT
Description: Myoclonus consistent with CBS - right side

Name: ALSFIND
Description: Findings suggesting ALS (e.g., muscle wasting, fasciculations, upper motor and/or lower motor neuron signs)

Name: GAITNPH
Description: Normal pressure hydrocephalus - gait apraxia

Name: OTHNEUR
Description: Other findings (e.g., cerebella ataxia, chorea, myoclonus)
